comments.body: addressof (at least) is around since a while, necessary in some cases and unfortunately not documented. Perhaps we need to do something about this.

Yes. I will for sure document everything that is in the API, but for these guys I still do not know exactly how to expose it. Their docs won't go in the Doxygen because they do not correspond to any C++ class in ROOT. We will need to have some docs taken from the ROOT Python module itself, as things we (still) expose from Cppyy.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +31,35 @@
        # Expose some functionality from CPyCppyy extension module
        cppyy_exports = [ 'Double', 'Long', 'nullptr', 'addressof', 'bind_object' ]
        for name in cppyy_exports:
            setattr(self, name, getattr(cppyy_backend, name))
